roleset.name: to remove surgically, surgically excising part of a tissue
roleset.note: RESECT-V NOTES: Based on data in Clinical Notes corpus (from resect.01-v)
RESECTION-N NOTES: Comparison to excise.01 (from resection.01-n)

roles.note: It can be hard to decide if you are removing a whole organ or just a part. When in doubt, first look up the procedure. If still in doubt, use arg 1. (from resection.01-n)

example.name: Arg0, Arg1
example.text: The doctor resected the seventh rib on the right side.
example.arg: the seventh rib on the right side

example.name: Arg1
example.text: Transurethral resection of the prostate (TURP) is surgery to remove all or part of the prostate gland, to treat an enlarged prostate.

example.name: You can actually remove a rectum and anus. This particular procedure is done with incisions made in the abdomin and perineum.
example.text: Rectum and anus, abdominal perineal resection

roleset.name: able to be removed surgically
roleset.note: RESECTABLE-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on medi-tmprl1to8. Relation to resect.01. (from resectable.01-j)

example.name: arg1
example.text: [The mass around the left ureter]-1 appears *PRO*-1 to be resectable to me .
